definition: to delay
surname Chi
late/delayed/slow
surname Yan
to prolong/to extend/to delay

sentences.english: Jo wrathfully proposed that Mr. Davis be arrested without delay.
sentences.chinese: 裘怒冲冲地提议，应当把戴维先生毫不迟延地逮起来。

sentences.english: The carrier's li-ability for the delay in delivery of the goods shipped on deck is also discussed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 同时，对承运人对舱面货的迟延交付责任等作了讨论。

sentences.english: They were granted a delay of 48 hours to gather more evidence.
sentences.chinese: 准许他们迟延48小时，以收集更多的证据。

sentences.english: I will hasten and not delay to obey your commands.
sentences.chinese: 我急忙遵守你的命令，并不迟延。

sentences.english: The legal liability of delay of acceptance is rather weak. Acceptance is a kind of nonstandard duty.
sentences.chinese: 受领迟延的法定责任较弱，因其是一种不真正义务。

sentences.english: This work must go forward without lag.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作必须毫不迟延地进行。

sentences.english: And that’s often why God delays.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么神常常迟延的原因。

sentences.english: I showed him the equipment without delay .
sentences.chinese: 我毫不迟延地向他出示了设备。

sentences.english: I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.
sentences.chinese: 我急忙遵守你的命令，并不迟延。

sentences.english: We easily grow impatient of God's delays.
sentences.chinese: 诚然，有许多时候我们顶容易不耐神的迟延。

sentences.english: Then open the door and run; don't delay!'
sentences.chinese: 说完了，就开门逃跑，不要迟延。

sentences.english: Then open the door， and flee， and tarry not.
sentences.chinese: 说完了，就开门逃跑，不要迟延。

sentences.english: For yet a little while, and he that shall come will come, and will not tarry.
sentences.chinese: 因为还有一点点时候，那要来的就来，并不迟延。

definition: to delay/to procrastinate
to decline/to avoid/shirking responsibilities/to blame others/to pass the buck/to unload one's responsibilities/to try to get out of a task
to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
main content/matter/work/origin of an incident/cause/purpose/subject (of business letter)
to delay/to procrastinate
disobedient/to violate the Mandate of Heaven (天命[Tian1 Ming4])
to discuss together/to try to reach a common judgment/panel discussion
to renege/to go back (on a deal)/to back out (of a promise)
to fall short in one's payments/to lack/to be short of
to extend (a deadline etc)
down payment/advance payment
to pay in full/to pay all of a bill/to pay off
to set a time limit/time limit/deadline
to neglect/to trifle with/not to take seriously
to break an agreement/to go back on one's word/to fail to keep one's promise
as yet undecided/unsolved/still outstanding
